turns.speaker: GAY BUM
turns.text: Isn't that awful? Poor Brenda Frazier. Poor Little Gloria. They ruined them! THEY ATE THEM ALIVE!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: It was a crime.

turns.speaker: GAY BUM
turns.text: Leave me alone...I wanna go...

turns.speaker: LEATHER
turns.text: You shouldn't hang around this neighborhood.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I... I was just leaving.

turns.speaker: LEATHER
turns.text: People spend a lot of hard earned money for this neighborhood.  It's not fair... looking out their windows to see your ass asleep on the streets...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes... I... I agree...

turns.speaker: LEATHER
turns.text: Good.  You believe this drunk?

turns.speaker: LEATHER
turns.text: .....Me neither.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: <u>No</u>...<u>No</u> <u>please</u>...!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Can I ask that when you clean your hands you wipe the ink off the inside of the sink before it stains the stainless steel.

turns.speaker: SONDRA
turns.text: You can ask.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: About dinner as a concept or about dinner with...  <u>Raoul</u>?

turns.speaker: SONDRA
turns.text: You're so witty.  I'm so jealous... I <u>need</u> to get out of here, Jack, and do something other than sit in this apartment and count how many funny lines you have per page.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You know, tomorrow's a very big day for me... It would be nice if you acted like you understood.

turns.speaker: SONDRA
turns.text: Fine.  I'll say no.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: They're putting me on film tomorrow.

turns.speaker: SONDRA
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: ... First time in my life I'll be a voice with a body.  Do you know what that means?  What this could lead to?

turns.speaker: SONDRA
turns.text: Jack, it's a sitcom -- you're not defining Pi.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll remember that the next time you get excited by drawing pubic hairs on raisin bran.  Want some?

turns.speaker: SONDRA
turns.text: No, I have to work.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How un-sixties of you.

turns.speaker: SONDRA
turns.text: I was nine in the sixties.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I used to think my biography would be JACK LUCAS - THE FACE BEHIND THE VOICE, but now it can be JACK LUCAS, THE FACE "AND" THE VOICE...or maybe just JACK - EXCLAMATION POINT...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hello Lydia?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Yeah?  Who is this?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes well...  You are a credit card holder, are you not?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Huh-huh.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, congratulations Lydia, because out of several thousand card holders... in conjunction with several major credit card companies...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Which ones?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: All of them... Which means <u>you</u> have just won a free membership at our store on Second Avenue.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Your name was picked.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Well, I don't understand.  What did you do -- did you pick my name out of a hat or... or... a list?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A list.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Well -- were there a lot of people in the room or just you or what?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well there....  What's the difference?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Well, I mean... I don't know you... This has never... I've never won anything and... I don't have a VCR.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You get a VCR with the membership.  ... For a short time until you get your own.  Listen, why don't you come down to the store and you can check it out.  See if you're interested.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Did Phyllis in accounting tell you to call me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: <u>No!</u>  <u>I told you</u>! <u>You won a contest</u>!

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Hello. My name is Lydia Sinclair.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes. Hi..Congratulations. Jack Lucas. Nice to meet you finally. This is Anne Napolitano, the owner of Video Spot.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: So how do we do this?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well..um...you get an official membership card...  Just sign that and we'll laminate it right here... Parry?  You want to laminate Miss Sinclair's card?...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh... you... you can pick out up to ten movies...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Free?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes.  They're free.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You know, Anne does other people too. Sort of a sideline...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, since you're a member, we could...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Okay... twenty dollars... When can you...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tonight!  How's tonight?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Could you help me-- what was the name of that girl who just came in...

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: What girl?  I didn't notice.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh... she was wearing a kind of... a flouncy kind of... uh... plain...

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Oh, Lydia!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Lydia.  Lydia what?

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: God, I have no idea.  She's worked here for fifteen years and I have no idea.  I'll call her.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No... no... that's all right... I thought I knew her... Thanks...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Please don't hurt me?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: "OH beings blind! What ignorance besets you!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I need a drink.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I know a great place.  ...UH...WARREN!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is it. I'm in hell. Damned to an eternity of idiotic conversation.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Great place huh?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Have I died?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Hahahahaaa... Nononono... Not yet... Hahahaha...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If you're going to murder me, that's fine... just don't laugh.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where am I?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: My abode... My domicile... My neck of the woods... Hungry?  Breakfast?  A fruit pie perhaps?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No... thanks... Listen --

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: My name is Parry.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hi... Where are my shoes?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: They're --  -- What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where -- ?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: <u>What</u>!?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: <u>What</u>?!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Sshhhh!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Do you know what the Little People just told me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The Little People?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: They said you're The One.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm the one what?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: <u>Oh shut up</u>!!!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: ... I've got a right to say something.  I mean, you're tying my hands here!  They say you're not ready to know.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm not...  Now, where are those shoes...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: ... Do you know who I am?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uhh... I'm drawing a blank.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Take a guess...  <u>Let him guess</u>!!  <u>Tch</u>.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh... gee... well... you seem to be some kind of vigilante...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: No, no... I mean that sort of happens along the way but no...  I'm on a very special quest.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A quest?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: But I need help and <u>they</u> sent you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The Little...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: They work for Him.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Him...?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: God... I'm the janitor of God.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The Holy Grail?  Some billionaire has the Holy Grail sitting in a commode on Madison Avenue?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I know!  You can't imagine how surprised I was.  Who would think you could find anything divine on the Upper East Side.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Listen... I don't mean to be flippant or to enrage you or anything but... you're an imbecile.  And I'm not The One... I'm not <u>any</u> One...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I think you're a very nice... very nice psychotic man.  I really appreciate what you did for me.  It was a very brave and noble thing...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Oh, please... you're embarrassing me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I wish you all the luck in the world. When you get the Grail, I'm sure I'll be seeing lots of you on various talk shows...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: But I can't get it... He's...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: See, you don't know him... That's why you're the one... You can get it...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Listen, forget the shoes.  I'll just take a cab... Uh...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Parry.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Parry... I'm Jack.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I know...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thanks... You can keep the doll.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Thanks a mill --  And I'll give you a buzz as soon as I hear from the people upstairs and we'll get this thing off the ground... Thanks for stopping by, Jack.  Give my love to the wife and kids.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm not married.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Funny -- you look married.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: "Soveriegn princess of his captive heart what dire affliction has thou made me suffer, thus banished from thy presence with reproach, and fettered by thy rigorous command, not to appear again before thy beautiful face. Deign princess, to remember this thy faithful slave, who now endures such misery for love of thee"....

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Parry!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do you follow her every day?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Huh-huh. I'm deeply smitten.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What's her name?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why did you do that?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Well, if every time someone did something offensive they hit in the head with a pebble, I think they might alter their behavior. What do you think Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Here...I just would like to help you. I thought...maybe...you could use some money.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Fifty dollars?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Here's another twenty. Will that do?  I mean, what's it going to take!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: No..no, it's..I don't know what to say. This is so nice of you...Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's O.K.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Can I take you to lunch?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No..I have to get back to work. Take care of yourself.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Well, I think you should be realistic. Ya can't start an ad agency on fifty dollars!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What are you doing?  Give that back!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But I gave it to you!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Well what am I gonna do with it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know. But I gave it to you...to help YOU...not him.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: You really want to help me?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Pretty impressive huh?...Don't let it scare you. I'll admit it's formidable but everything has it's weakness.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You can't just break into Langdon Carmichael's house. This man has done nothing.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: O.K...let me explain this one more time...The Holly Grail is in -....

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: All right! Listen - please...don't start drooling or...rolling your eyes when I tell you this but - You shouldn't do this..There is no Holy Grail.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Of course there is, Jack. What do you think the Crusades were - a frat initiation? I don't think so...There has to be a Grail.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look, you're only sort of insane, really. People like you can lead semi-normal lives. You could get a job...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I don't need a job. I have a quest.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I take it back - you're fucking deranged... And you're going to get yourself killed trying to get in there!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Tch. You are so sweet...Now I know why you're saying this. ...You're afraid I'm in danger and you're trying to protect me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No. I think you're a moron and I don't want to get into trouble.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: ...You are such a great guy. First the money, now this.  Isn't he fabulous!?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Please don't hug me in public again, O.K.?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I LOVE THIS MAN...YA HEAR ME JADED CITY...  ...I'M DAFFY ABOUT THIS GUY AND I DON'T CARE WHO KNOWS IT!!!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Will you shut-up!!!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: You're a true <u>friend</u>.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm not. Believe me. <u>I'm</u> scum.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: You're a real honest to goodness <u>good</u> guy.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm self-centered, I'm weak - I don't have the will power of a <u>fly</u> on shit...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: That's why the Little People sent you. Just <u>like</u> magic.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't believe in little floating people! THERE IS NO MAGIC!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: So what? You going to help me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: WILL YOU PLEASE... please listen to me ...  You know none of this is true -                           PARRY the Grail, the voices...                           Jack... There's a part of you that                         Come on...what are knows this isn't true.                             saying... I know who you are...                              I know who you are.. or who you were.                                   You're acting really- You don't belong on the                            No, no, no, no... streets. You're intelligent                        Jack... man....you're a teacher...                         Jacck!... You were a teach at Hunter College. Don't you remember?...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: He knows who you are!  He's afraid!  I can tell!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're totally gone, aren't you?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Isn't it great up here... He's gone now, but we had him on the run! We would've had his ass if we had horses! He's running scared!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: WHO! WHO'S RUNNING?!! WHO HAVE WE BEEN CHASING!?? CAN I ASK THIS QUESTION NOW!!!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: SAW WHO!!?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: The Red Knight!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The Red...?  You're totally gone, aren't you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Parry...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Buddy, the days of the debutantes are ... not what they used to be.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Listen, he just needs to sleep it off. Someone will take care of him.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, maybe he wants to stay here.  Do...do you want to stay here?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's such a great song.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: It's a classic.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't you think it's time to go now? Running around here during the day is one thing but at night we could be killed by a wide variety of people.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Well that's stupid. This is my park just as much as it is theirs. You think it's fair they keep us out just because they make us think we'll get killed or something?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes. I think that's very fair.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: .....What are you doing?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Have you ever done any cloudbusting? You lie on your back and you concentrate on the clouds...and you try yo break them apart with your mind. It's wild.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You can't do this! This is New York! Nobody lies in naked in a field in New York..It's...it's too Midwestern.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Come on, try it. Ya feel the air on your body - ya little fella's flappin' in the breeze. ...everybody in the city is busy with their business and no one knows we're bare assed in the middle of it. Come on!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: NO! I will not! This is nuts! I'm leaving! I mean it...this is nuts.  This is too nuts...I'm leaving. I mean it!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: ..Ha...Little fella? I mean the man talks to invisible people - he sees invisible horses - and he's naked in the middle of Central Park. I should be surprised? I'm not surprised. I'm fucking outta my mind to even be here!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Who are you talking to Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: YOU'RE OUT OF YOUR FUCKING MIND!!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Bingo!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Are there any questions?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Then let's begin with the story itself. It's a story of the Grail myth...And although there are several variations, my favorite begins with the Fisher King as a young boy... who had to spend a night alone in the forest to prove his courage... and during that night, he is visited by a sacred vision. Out of the fire, appears the Holy Grail - God's highest symbol of divine grace. And a voice says to the boy, "You shall be the guardian of the Grail, that it may heal the hearts of men"...But the boy was overcome ...Innocent and foolish, he was blinded by greater visions - a life ahead filled with beauty and glory, hope and power...Tears filled his eyes as he sensed his own... invincibility. A boy's tears of naive wonder and inspiration. and in this state of...radical amazement...he felt for a brief moment, not like a boy, but like God...  ...And so he reached into the fire to take the Grail. And the Grail vanished. And the boy hands were left caught in the flames...leaving him wounded and ashamed at what his recklessness had lost him. When he became King, he was determined to reclaim his destiny and find the Grail... But with each year that passed, with each campaign he fought, the Grail remained lost, and this wound he suffered in the fire grew worse... He became a bitter man. Life for him lost it's reason. With each disappointment, with each betrayal... with each loss ... this wound would grow... Soon the land began to spoil from neglect and his people starved...Until finally, the King lost all faith in God's existance and in man's value...He lost his ability to love or be loved And he was so sick with experience... that he started to die. As the years went on, his bravest knights would search for the Grail that would heal their King and make them the most respected and valued men in the land, but to no avail.  Pretty soon, finding the Grail became a ruthless struggle between ambitious men vying for the King's power, which only confirmed the King's worst suspicions of man, causing his wound to grow. His only hope, he thought, was death. Then one day, a fool was brought in to the King to cheer him.  He was a simple-minded man... not particularly skilled...or admired... He tells the King some jokes...sing him some songs, but the King feels even worse...Finally, the fool says, "What is it that hurts you so much? How can I help?"...And the King says, "I need a sip of water to cool my throat"...So, the fool takes a cup from the bedstand, fills it with water and hands it to the King...Suddenly, the King feels a lot better. And when he looks to his hands, he sees that it was the Holy Grail the fool handed him...an ordinary cup that had been beside his bed all along...And the King asks, "How can this be?...how could you find what all my knights and wisest men could not find"? And the fool answers, "I don't know. I only knew you were thirsty."... And for the first time since he was a boy, the King felt more than a man - not because he was touched by God's glory...but rather, by the compassion of a fool.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I can't ask for her...I have to earn her.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Parry, you don't have to <u>earn</u> a woman. It's the twentieth century.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Maybe, when we get the Grail...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, see, I think she can help...You know women are great..they...they make homes and they..ya know, kill the livestock so the knights can go out and get Grails and...and slaughter villages with a clear head...I mean, where would Arthur be without Guinevere...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Happily married, probably.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Bad example. Just trust me. A woman who loves you keeps you going...gives you strength... Makes you feel like you can do anything...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Is that what your girlfriend does for you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sure...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Holdin' my penis...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: <u>Parry</u>!  Close your pants...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Will you stand still so I can do this!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I'm sorry....I'm just so excited.  You must have felt this way when you first met Anne, huh? Where did you two meet?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: In a bar called Hellfire.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Tch...how romantic. Yeah. If I wasn't already committed to Lydia, boy. Except Anne'd never go for me though. She loves you too much. And you really love her, huh?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No. But that's not the only reason people get together or..stay together.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: What are the other reasons?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: ...I feel so much for her...I feel like something awful is going to happen.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No. Nothing bad's going to happen. Anne'll be there. I'll be there. Nothing bad will happen.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I'm still scared.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Parry, it's Lydia Sinclair - our membership winner.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I know!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Beautiful night huh?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah.....Hey they're moving....  Am I doing that?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Unhand that degenerate - you adolescent ass of a one balled donkey!

turns.speaker: LEATHER
turns.text: It's just a bum...You know, there's enough in here for the two of you.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Ha, ha, ha, ha rubbish...now begone...before somebody drops a house on you!...

turns.speaker: LEATHER
turns.text: You a fag too?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: <u>Fag..a</u> <u>fag</u> <u>you</u> <u>say!?</u>... <u>"Curst</u> <u>wolf!</u> <u>Thy</u> <u>fury</u> <u>inward</u> <u>on</u> <u>thyself</u> <u>Pray</u> <u>and</u> <u>consume</u> <u>thee!"</u>

turns.speaker: LEATHER
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: LEATHER
turns.text: OWWW....What are you nuts?!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: BINGO! Tell the man what he's won!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I advise you to let us go.

turns.speaker: LEATHER
turns.text: You advise us!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: You're out numbered son.

turns.speaker: LEATHER
turns.text: Come on! Go for it! What the hell are they gonna do? They can't do nothin!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: <u>Nothing!</u> <u>They</u> <u>can</u> <u>do</u> <u>nothing!</u> <u>Gentlemen!</u>

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: LEATHER
turns.text: OWW...MAN...

turns.speaker: LEATHER
turns.text: You can't leave me tied up out here alone, you fucking faggot!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: You won't be alone for long.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Parry Parry?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: No just Parry.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Oh...like Moses.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: How about the "Hell Merchants"?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I don't like horror movies!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: How about... Zbiegnew Speizak's "The Purple Bread," an intensely portrayed tale of love and envy set against the sweeping background of a Polish bakery.  In subtitles.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I don't like... uh...  Polish love stories...  ... I like musicals.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Well, we have plenty of those.  Right over here.  We got the MGM series, Astaire and Rogers, the Judy Garlands...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Got any Ethel Merman?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: ... Uh... we seem to be all out of Ethel Merman.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: What a gyp.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: ...I..uh..I get to read some of the books but mostly I..just calculate production costs from first edition hard cover publication to paperback. After paperback it's basically someone else's problem.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: It sounds exciting.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Why does it sound exciting? There's absolutely nothing exciting about it.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: We mostly publish trashy romance novels.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Well - empires have fallen because of trashy romances...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: How do you know him?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: We were neighbors for a couple for weeks on Sutton Place.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: What do you do - for a living I mean?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Well, I'm in search of the Holy Grail.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Tell me more. I want to know everything.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: There isn't any more to tell.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Don't say that.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: No, really..believe me - there isn't any more. This is it.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Well, it's enough for me.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: You don't have to say that.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I never say anything I have to.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I mean you don't have to say nice things to me... That kind of thing is a little old fashioned for what we're about to do.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: What are we about to do?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Well... you're walking me home.  I... I guess you're sort of... attracted to me and you'll want to come upstairs for... coffee...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I don't drink coffee...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: ... and then we'll probably have a drink and talk and get comfortable with each other and... and we'll... then you'll sleep over and then in the morning...  ... you'll be distant and you won't be... able to stay for breakfast... you'll just have some coffee maybe...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I don't drink coffee...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: And then we'll exchange phone numbers and you'll leave and never call and I'll go to work and feel great for the first hour and then slowly turn into a piece of dirt by lunch.  Why am I putting myself through this?  It was very nice... uh meeting you. Good night..

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Excuse me...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Listen, I'm not feeling well.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Well, no wonder.  We just met, made love and broke up all in the space of thirty seconds and I can't even remember the first kiss which is the best part.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Listen, you're very nice... b...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: So are you, but I think maybe you should shut up now...  ... I'm not coming up to your apartment.  That was never my idea.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Oh... You mean you don't want to.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Oh no, I want to.  I've got a hard-on for you the size of Canada... but I don't... want just one night.  I have a confession to make?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: You're married.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Divorced.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: No, I...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: You have a disease.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Will you stop!...  ... I'm in love with you...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: ... It's not just from tonight.  I've known you for a long time.  I see you come out of work every day.  I walk with you to lunch.  I know what you order... I see you buy Baby Ruths before going back in...  I know how you feel on certain days by whether or not you go into the bookstore...  ... I know you hate your job and you don't have many friends and you sometimes feel like you're not as... as wonderful as everybody else and you're a little uncoordinated  ... and feeling like you're the only one who's as separate and... alone as you are... and I love you.   I love you.  I think you're the greatest thing since... spice racks and I would be knocked out several times if I even got just a first kiss.  But I'll be back in the morning.  And I won't be distant.  And I will call if you let me... But I still don't drink coffee.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Shhh...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: See, I told you it was him...  Your name's Donnie something, right?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I leave it to you.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: My name is Shirley, but they call me Betty, and her name's Twinky.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Twinky?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yeah, 'cause she's so "twinky"...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well, Betty and Twinky, it sure is nice talking to you girls. I just wish I had more time...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: That's a wig you wear, isn't it?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: A wig?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yeah, I told her it was you, but that you're wearing a wig, 'cause on TV you're mostly bald in the front.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Your little friend's real sharp there...  Yeah, I don't like to wear the wig on TV, because with two and a half million people watching you, you've gotta be sincere. I just like to wear it when I'm out slippin' around bowling alleys an' things like that. I think it gives me a little more class, don't you?

turns.speaker: ELTON
turns.text: We gotta get on home an' relieve the sitter. Why'nt you an' Ray come on over.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Okay. Go ahead. I'll settle up for the beers...  An' walk Rayette over with you, will you.

turns.speaker: ELTON
turns.text: Give 'em the horn, Bob.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Look at these assholes! What the hell are they doing?!

turns.speaker: ELTON
turns.text: Well, id'n that nice.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: It's ridiculous! I'm sitting here, listening to some asshole cracker compare his life to mine!

turns.speaker: ELTON
turns.text: If you're sayin' you're somethin' better'n what I am, that's one thing. But I can't say much a someone who'd run off an' leave a woman in a situation like this an' feel easy about it. An' that's all I gotta say.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I hope that's all you gotta say, El, 'cause I'm about as tired of your mouth as I am workin' this stinkin' hole!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Tell me what in the hell's going on, Elton!

turns.speaker: ELTON
turns.text: I got accused a robbin' a fillin'station down in the Indian Nation, didn' I tell you...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You're not going to play it again.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Well, lemme play the other side then.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Now quit, Bobby. You said you're goin' a help me pick a song.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You said.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Well, lemme sing the one I picked an' see what you think...  "When there's a fire in your heart/Break the glass/Sound the alarm..."

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: How 'bout if I just cut off your damn water?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm too moved by your gentility to speak.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Sugar, you know how I feel about you, don't you? I'm just tryin' to get you to take an interest in my kind a things, an' what I'm tryin' to do with myself...  You know, there id'n anything in the world I wouldn't do for you, baby. I started livin' the day I found you, you know that?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You're playing the other side.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Cerveza.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Serveza yourself!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Now, now.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: No, dammit, I would easy.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Why'nt you take 'at sign off your tit, Ray, an' let's go on out.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Out where?

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: I'll go out with you, or I'll stay here, and do anything you'd like for me to do... if you'll just do one thing. If you'll tell me that you love me.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You can sing the song.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: You know what, you are never satisfied.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's right, hand.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: I'm tryin', baby, so don't start gettin' mad now.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No, I'm not mad at you, hand. It'll be all right. Just spot and follow through...

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Is it my turn again?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Right. Now show me a little somethin' this time, okay? Give me some form...

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: I can't help it, honey, the ball just keeps goin' cocky wobbly on me...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Will you just do what the hell I tell you...

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: I did, didn' I, El?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You got another ball comin'.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: That was damn good, wad'n it? I finally did it...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, great.  Why don't you throw Z's for 19 frames, and then roll a strike on the last ball in the last frame of a losing game? Just wonderful.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Come on. We're goin' over to Elton's.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: I'm not.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You just going to sit there?

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Okay. Hope no one hits on you.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: I hope they do.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Come on, DiPesto. We can still have a good time.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: You're the pathetic one, not me.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm going on over there...

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: I'm not some piece a crap.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I know you're not.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: You treat me like I was.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: You go slippin' around in front a my face, an' in front a Elton an' Stoney. What do you imagine they think a someone you treat that way...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Now, hand...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Elton and Stoney know how I feel about you. An' they're just goin' to think I'm not too nice a guy, which I'm not, an' that you're a hell of a person puttin' up with me, that's all.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: You're goin' a find me dead one time.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Sssh, come on now...  Be a good girl.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: If you really want a get up an' leave me, you can read about it in the newsprint.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm not going to get up an' leave you.  Now let's go over to El's an' have a good time.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Do you love me, Bobby?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'll be gone two or three weeks.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: You'll be gone, period.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: You like it?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I love it.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: "You'll be burned out/Or smoked out/An' come back to me, I know..."

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: "Every trail that you blaze/Makes me..."

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What the hell is that?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: I'll tell you...  ... l-a-t-e-r.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Just one minute, you! Don't you ever talk to me like that!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Shut up! All of you!

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Are you depressed about your daddy, honey?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: I 'magine it's me then, id'n it?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Is what you?

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: You're depressed that I come along.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Who said I was depressed?

turns.speaker: RAYETTE
turns.text: Well, is that a happy face I see?
